reviews.review_msg: Awesome prof, makes everything really interesting, lots of guest lecturers. Show up and you'll get an A, pretty obvious what will be on tests.

Angie is an amazing prof and person. She is super accessible for help and really wants her students to learn, not memorize. She emphasizes big picture concepts. You should do well if you put the time in.

There's a lot to memorize but it is not a difficult class at all! I don't have a kin or bio background and I did well in this course. The exams are very straight forward. Angela is an amazing professor and a nice person.

Just to prove the course wasn't a "slam dunk", the prof included in the course 2 midterms and a final (all cumulative), a written assignment, a group presentation, and pop quizzes nearly every single tutorial. Study off ppt notes and you should be fine. Just alot of tedious work involved.

She is an amazing professor. Her lectures are clear, informative, and interesting. She was "new" when I took her in Spring 2009 and she was fabulous. I know a lot of these ratings are subjective, but I believe students should take her class(es) at some point. Her midterms and exams were based on both notes and textbook so study and you'll do great!
